clinical_study.brief_title: Whether it is More Appropriate to Spray Lugol's Solution From Cervical Esophagus to Esophagogastric Junction
clinical_study.official_title: Whether it is More Appropriate to Spray Lugol's Solution From Cervical Esophagus to Esophagogastric Junction

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare the effectiveness and safety of spraying Lugol's solution from cervical esophagus to esophagogastric junction (downward) and from esophagogastric junction to cervical esophagus （upward）during chromoendoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Chromoendoscopy using Lugol's solution is effective for the detection of early esophageal squamous neoplasia. However, there is no study to investigate the sequence of Lugol's staining during endoscopic procedure.
The aim of this study is to compare the effectiveness and safety of spraying Lugol's solution from cervical esophagus to esophagogastric junction (downward) and from esophagogastric junction to cervical esophagus （upward）during chromoendoscopy.

primary_outcome.description: Image quality is blindly quantified by a 4-point scale from the endoscopists. A higher score representing higher image quality.

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events of the two groups.
Usage of Lugol's solution in each group.
Detection rate of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma of the two groups.

The 4-point scale was used to assess the tolerance of endoscopist to the esophageal spasm caused by Lugol's solution which prevent endoscopy from passing. 1-4 means the resistance as intolerable, tolerable, mild, or non-existing.

arm_group.description: This group patients were given Lugol's solution staining from cervical esophagus to esophagogastric junction （downward）during chromemdoscopy.
